# Path to the JSON files
json_path = "abfss://data@dp203dushyantdatalake.dfs.core.windows.net/Event_Hub_Data/"

# Try reading the JSON files
try:
    # Read the JSON data
    cleaned_df = spark.read.json(json_path)
    cleaned_df.show(10)  # Display the DataFrame to verify
except Exception as e:
    print("An error occurred while reading the JSON files:", str(e))

# Event Hub connection parameters
event_hub_namespace = "eventhubjsonsales.servicebus.windows.net"
event_hub_name = "eventhubjsonsales"
sas_key_name = "RootManageSharedAccessKey"
sas_key = ""

# Define Event Hub connection properties
event_hub_config = {
    "eventhubs.connectionString": f"Endpoint=sb://{event_hub_namespace}/;SharedAccessKeyName={sas_key_name};SharedAccessKey={sas_key};EntityPath={event_hub_name}"
}

# Define the DataFrame to send
# cleaned_df = ... (assuming cleaned_df is already defined)

# Send the DataFrame to Event Hub
try:
    cleaned_df.write \
        .format("eventhubs") \
        .options(**event_hub_config) \
        .save()
    print("DataFrame successfully sent to Event Hub.")
except Exception as e:
    print("An error occurred while sending the DataFrame to Event Hub:", str(e))
